rComments: Professor Martyna is one of those professors people seem to either love ore hate. I was  lucky to be one of the people that loved her. She talked about social problems and always ended class with a movement working to fight those problems. The class is pretty easy. There is a lot of reading! She allows a page of notes for tests.

Wendy is a beautiful speaker and very nice. However, this course seemed very common sensical. The readings were flourishing with information, but she did not take much class time to discuss their deep content; she spent time on trivial things such as texting, dating apps, and watching tons of videos. I learned nothing, but I got an A.

AMAZING. Wendy is the best teacher I've had at UCSC. She's such an eloquent, intelligent lecturer; the only person I can pay full attention to for an hour and a half.  She assigns a ton of reading but it's usually quite interesting. You can still get an A by skimming the textbook and skipping parts of books - just get the full concepts.

Wendy is my favorite professor of all time as she is very witty and passionate. She is so knowledgable and knows how to teach! She is respectful of every students personal views. I learn something new every lecture. All the material is interwoven with relevant issues  personal stories and readings are intriguing and informative. Worth your while.
Amazing professor! She opened up my eyes and thanks to her I have become more mindful. Her class is an easy A if you do the readings of course. The books are really interesting. I recommend Wendy!

Wendy is great. Written assignments are easy and straightforward. Tests are phrased strangely but aren't impossible to do well on with your cheat sheet. It is imperative that you do all of the reading or you WILL NOT pass. Reading is slightly overwhelming but not too bad. This class is about concept, not terms and memorization. Overall pretty easy.

Wendy is a great professor and can crack a joke every once in a while. She does assign a lot of reading, about 4 books, but you do read them cover to cover, so you get your moneys worth. If you stay on top of your work and go to class you should have no problem passing the class. She does allow you to have a cheat sheet for the midterm and final.

Very smart professor with very witty methods of teaching. She will talk about life experiences but eventually tie them to the course material. Eventually she encourages us to make sense of the material through our lives. She knows how to make the material relevant and rather practical. I would recommend her.

I LOVE WENDY I WANT HER TO TEACH ALL MY CLASSES.  She is an excellent and experienced professor and has a great teaching style. She assigns lots of writing but is not too tough a grader. You will watch many interesting films and everything she teaches you is explained thoroughly.
:(...Very mediocre, scattered, and often unengaging. Wendy might teach Death and Dying very well, but Soc. of Language was much worse than I expected; very descriptive-oriented content class.
Great teacher, reasonable assignments, fair grading.

I took wendy for family and society and social psych. i really enjoyed her for social psychology. she wants you to ACTUALLY do the readings....meaning everything! the tests will include ALL of the material including clips and videos in class. her multiple choice tests are kindov tricky, so read very carefully.overall I though she was GREAT!

Hated this class. Lecture style were unorganized and didn't teach me anything new. Topic and readings were interesting but lecture style was dull and slow. 40 question exams some multiple choice and open ended questions: based on reading (which is impossible to keep up with) and measure what you know ineffectively. Tests are hard bc she is picky.

Professor Martyna is such an intelligent instructor. Like other reviewers have said, she pushes you to critically analyze the material and integrate it within your own life and the society around you. She blends sociology and psychology together perfectly. If you're interested in either discipline, you won't be let down at all!

I think Wendy is misunderstood and different. Instead of literally talking about facts she wants us to critically think. She assigns little kid books to allow yourself to engage with the material on a more personal level. Her classes have helped me through personal issues which has helped me grow as an individual. Don't insult it, embrace it.

Wendy is an awesome teacher. Yes, she is particular about a few things but once you have those things down, you're set! I honestly learned so much in her class and enjoyed coming every meeting. Just realize that all of the reading she assigns is what's on the tests and essays, her class lectures often don't touch upon every reading.
I loved Wendy and her class. I found her inspirational and extremely helpful in my growth as a Psych major. Highly recommend!
Awesome Lecturer. The only thing I didn't like is that she showed to many movies...

This class had many interesting concepts and Martyna means well and tries to help but her teaching style was not compatible w/ my learning style. Her tests are horrible, 40 multiple choice and short answers. I read the books, went to class and still got a C+ on the midterm. The test aren't reflective of what's been taught in the course.

If you are a good writer, take this class. If you are not a good writer, you are in for a long quarter. Do all the reading, the midterm and finals are based on them. Also ATTEND EVERY LECTURE and take notes, Wendy often pulls obscure test questions from class ramblings.
She was a very helpful professor.  If I had any questions I could go to her during office hours and she was really helpful. She also improved my writing a lot by giving me lots of feedback.
The best teacher. Compassionate, brilliant, and very helpful. I only had her for core, but I recommend taking any class she teaches

The best professor I've ever had!!  She loves what she is teaching and she will make you love it too!  Take anything with her because you will actually enjoy the reading that you have to do for the class.  She is very fair and always willing to help.
Shes one of the best sociology teachers at ucsc. Her lectures are so clear that the points just sink in. It is hard to write notes yet you still come out of class smarter than when you came in.
No Comments

i've had dr. martyna for two classes now, and i absolutely love her teaching style. lectures are relaxed, and fluid. she pushes you to become a better writer. concept based, rather than extensive detail and research. i can see how her classes aren't for everyone, but if you have an interest in family/gender/social issues, look no further.

Her classes are fairly easy and the materials to read are not academically rigorous. However, attending her lectures is a test in patience and extracting the few useful points made. If you have some options, take a Socy professor that doesn't waste class time with life stories, sermons, and general tedious assignment minutiae.
Extremely easy! She is a psychology/sociology professor so the class was a lot about how we felt about issues/our emotions. Definitely an easy A class

Took Martyna for Death & Dying, Social Psych and Social Interaction/Language. Loved all of these courses, mainly because of her. She is so genuine and intelligent. I really appreciated her teaching style, she lectures in a personal way (not always about the text) and is very good at integrating a discussion in lecture

I've took 3 sociology courses with this professor and she is amazing, compassionate and genuine.  My experience at UCSC prior to taking classes with Martyna was less than mediocre.  She reached out and offered to help me work through my crazy schedule and was supportive of my ideas and papers.

Sociology 111 Family and Society. Easy class, I received an A. She is a great professor. You may think she goes off on a tangent on her stories but in the end it's relevant to the lectures. Has some really interesting videos and course book. Highly recommend taking the class.

had her for Sociology of Death & Dying. the class had a lot of potential to be interesting but wendy seemed to fail to bring it to the level i wanted. the textbook was interesting and some of the books were but the use of childrens books were tedious. it wasnt what i expected. her lectures were boring and far too spiritual. not enough raw sociology

Professor Martyna didn't make the most of the time spent in class. Much of what we did was play games and discuss slightly irrelevant material. However, I liked how she emphasized creative writing and she did introduce new ways of learning that were fun.
She is an interesting person but her teaching method is not my cup of tea. Perhaps she should try K-12 and not anything at the University level.

It astounds me that students have the ability to speak poorly about Dr. Martyna. I graduated in 2004 and her words continue to guide me professionally.  She was, by far, my most brilliant professor. She speaks in metaphors, and her lectures renew inspiration!

Wendy is a nice woman but does not know how to teach a college course. I learned nothing from this class and felt like it was a huge waste of time. A lot of "fluff" as someone below me said and a bunch of random kids books, movies, bizarre topics, etc. that did little to enhance the course. She's also terrible at getting work back to students

I had heard good things about Wendy. Unfortunately, they weren't true. She wanted us to buy 7 books, half of which were kids books. For the first half of the quarter she showed a lot of videos and I felt like she should have lectured more, but when she did "lecture more" during the second half of class all she did was read books out loud. Bad class

Class on "Sociology of Death & Dying." If you want an easy "A" but not actually learn any material, take this course. But if you seriously want to engage with materials and want an actual education, look elsewhere. Topic on death and dying is 100% worth studying, but not in the way Dr. Martyna does it--jumps around in lecture & has no framework.

Very uncritical look at the sociology of death and dying. Topic is fascinating but not the way Dr. Martyna does it. She teaches at an elementary school level--very fluffy stuff for college students. Uses problematic ideas such as "tribal societies" and "western culture" without being attune to specificities. Don't take if you want to learn.
She is an incredible teacher! Really helpful, friendly, insightful, great lecturer. She's basically great at everything! I love her! :D Any class that she teaches, I highly recommend it. :D

Wendy is the most amazing prof. ever. She really cares about her students and their work.  She will help you with your work for an hour or more if you go to her office hours. Take any class you can from her this woman is amazing.

Really cool teacher, great sense of humor, makes all kinds of jokes and references during her classes. Easy class, no stress about turning stuff in late, gives really good, in-depth feedback on all written work, although she takes a while to get anything back to you. Really friendly and easy to talk to, I recommend her highly.

Wendy's a pretty cool lady. She is a really easy grader as far as individual papers, but she's also really invested in giving thorough feedback (which unfortunately means it takes forever to get papers back). She's really approachable and interesting. She has realistic expectations, but she changes the syllabus a lot, so it's kind of confusing.
Nice lady. the lectures weren't very good, but the guest speakers and movies that she showed us were outstanding.

Passionate and interesting lecturer. However, she really shortchanged everyone in psych 109 though because she only talked about the social aspects of aging (which were blown way out of proportion) instead of also talking about the biological and psychological aspects of aging.
The most inspiring professor I have ever had. If I ever become famous, I will thank her on national TV...but she won't see it because she probably doesn't have one..dang, foiled again!
No Comments
she's amazing.

I took death and dying as well as sociology of love and enjoyed both classes. I liked the passion she has behind her teaching and although some may consider it an easy A, I found the class more about self discovery. Discussions, especially if you've had on
a
I did not like her class, it was set at the middle-school level.  Aside from the laughable reading list and lecture on how toys are like families, she is a very nice and caring person.

Wendy is an amazing woman, dedicated professor and passionate human being. i learned lessons from her i use daily and will never forget. it may take a while to get your papers back,stick it out it's worth it!
I took so many classes with Wendy, I love her!  She's is fabulous!
She rocks... a very easy A!
best teacher, always take her classes, learn about life and more, cares about students more than a grade.
The class is really boring, but she's a good teacher and she makes it bareable.  If you have any questions, she is really helpful.  Definetly go to her office hours!
No Comments
What can I say about Wendy that I'm sure hasn't already been said?.....probably nothing so I won't try. Keep it up Wendy!!

She's a great lecturer and she knows her material.  Loves reading books and she has a great list that writes down every day in class to add to your reading list. Take home midterms and finals (summer session) were very long, time consuming, and "ok" (not too easy or hard), but the other assignments were fun and easy. I recommend her 110%!

Wendy is an amazing teacher!  I had classes with her over eight years ago and still cinsider discussions I had we her.  Her teaching style, her passion and her love inspired me to pursue a career in academics.  I admire her tremendously and think of her often.  UCSC students are lucky to have her.

The class was really easy and pointless. She missed a lot of classes.  Basically, you just listen to what she says and write that down in your papers and assignments and you get an A.  She isn't an effective teacher, but she is really nice.

Wendy is a great person who cares.  Her teaching style is alittle fluffy, but because she cares the readings and the lectures do consistantly have worthwhile nuggets.  I can see why some people don't like her, but teaching isn't a popularity contest. She sucked at getting work back in a timely fashion, but again there was always something good.

I like Wendy on a personal level and the class is pretty easy (three two page papers and a mid-term and final with take-home portions that are pretty much open note), but I feel like her teaching style is kind of a cop-out. She assigns way too much reading and almost never talks about it in lecture, and we always watch films, so i didnt go much.

seemed more concerned with hearing her own voice than stimulating class discussion.  raised few interesting points. assignments were too broad. very bad at returing papers and assignments in a timely manner.
Great teacher, I am taking her next quarter because she is that good, I don't really care for the class, but love her teaching style.

Wendy ran a delightfully, intriguing and challenging class. The reading was on topic, and interesting. There were several 2 page papers, and the midterm and final were short answer/ essay (as to be expected with a social science class)

Wendy had a lasting impact on me in her teaching approach and personhood.  I appreciated her challenging my basic writing skills as well motivating me to excel in academics.  Frankly, she was a breath of fresh air.  By simplifying and relating class topics to real life she helped to make potentially complicated issues accessible.
Really nice when you get to know her.  Usually an easy grader

I really liked her as a teacher. She tries to connect real life situations to what she's teaching & she also tries to open up our minds instead of being swept up into what mainstream America wants us to think. Keep up with your reading s0o you wont be overloaded. Allowed cheat sheets with finals and midterms. The take-homes are purty simple.

A very chil class.  Wendy is gives you everything you need to know for the tests and lets you have a page of notes for the tests.  Just a word to the wise, if she likes you she will give you A's on everything.  Make sure she gets to know your name and your TA likes you too.  TAs aren't told what is on the test so don't listen to them.

Wendy is really nice when confronted, and is very knowledgable about the topics she teaches.  Although she might go off on tangents, they are interesting ones, and always pertain to class discussions.  Very good professor and I learned a lot from her.

Granted she was asked to teach this course last-minute the quarter I took it, but the amount of times she had guest lecturers/showed videos was really ridiculous. On the rare days she did actually lecture, I found them to be very interesting. Fairly easy to get an A if you keep up with the readings and attend class.

Wendy is so frustrating, she picks favorites and several times was really rude to students for no reason, just called them out in front of the class.  She babbles on about herself, trying to be cute or whatever.  I got a lower grade in core course than i've gotten in 3 years of school here.
This woman is full of hot air.  I learned nothing from her lectures.  She is completely biased and this class was one long rant.  Total waste of time.
passionate about issues and problems in america
Anyone who tells you this person is a good teacher is dumb and full of crap.  She is a disgrace to the teaching profession and would be better suited to teach children from K - 8

This class was easy bc you get to watch video clips, write essays, and have in-class exams (you get to have a cheat sheet each exam). It is hard to go to class because it's just a whole bunch of stories and people sharing their personal lives (cool for a class, but you wish you were doing something else). Wendy is a really nice person though!
Probably the best teacher I've ever had. She obviously cares very much about what she is teaching and looks to inspire those in her class.

She doesnt teach, you have to learn yourself from the books. Her lectures are a waste of time because to says obvious things and doesnt even say anything helpful for the books. I didnt learn anything from her, just the books. Alot of group therapy emotional bs thats not needed.

Very passionate.  Fair assignments.  Tough exams (but you get to use notes).  She is very disorganized and sometimes it's easy to miss main points.  She tries very hard to inspire students and encourage intellictual as well as personal growth (rare to find a teacher with this kind of passion).  A little fluffy at times but lovely to listen to.
Effing amazing teacher.  Whatever you do, don't write her off.  I plan to take courses I'm not even interested in just because she's teaching them.
"Hella tight."

This woman is an angel! Albeit she sings you Simon & Garfunkel songs and begins every lecture with inspirational quotes, it is this whimsical nature you grow to love. She's sweet, easy to talk to, and very responsive. Don't pass her off, she's worth every moment of your time! Very inspirational and you take with you much more than book learnin'.

She's very passionate and was very sensitive towards me in my freshmen year (as I'm sure she is to all freshmen).  I had expressed in a paper that I hoped to get Maxine Hong-Kingston's autograph when she came to Book Shop Santa Cruz.  Wendy went and didn't see me there so she had Maxine sign an advertisement of her book for me!!!  She lectures in a style that makes you think of the subject in a deep way rather than a "I have to study this for class" way.
No Comments
